thread.title: Mel B dropped some Spice Girls during her performance in Chicago | Metro News
thread.title_full: Mel B dropped some Spice Girls during her performance in Chicago | Metro News

author: Adam Starkey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Mel B dropped some Spice Girls during her performance in Chicago | Metro News
text:
Adam Starkey for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 21 Feb 2017 9:50 pm Amra-Faye Wright and Mel B starred in Broadway’s Chicago in New York (Picture: Walter McBride/WireImage) 
They say you should never forget your roots – something Mel B perhaps spontaneously recalled while performing in the Chicago musical on Broadway. David Beckham’s emotional Desert Island Discs saw him snub the Spice Girls and all of Victoria’s solo tracks 
The 41-year-old former Spice Girls star celebrated her last show playing Roxie Hart in Chicago by harking back to her girl power days – delivering a line from Spice Girls track Wannabe mid-performance. 
Taking to Instagram, Mel shared a clip of the slip online, writing: ‘Here is a snippet of me last night doing my last show in @chicagomusical playing Roxie heart breaking character busting out some spice power haha #nyc #broadwaybaby.’ A post shared by Mel B (@officialmelb) on Feb 20, 2017 at 10:10am PST 
In the clip, while strutting across the stage as Roxie – Mel casually dropped her infamous, ‘So here’s the story from A-Z’, from her rap in Wannabe to rapturous applause. 
‘Back to my character,’ she added once the Spice frenzy petered out. More
